Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and light, showing it is alive and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water and show how it looks different from a healthy plant.
The student can draw a plant kept in the dark and show how it changes or does not grow.
The student can use their drawings to identify patterns about plants needing water and light to live and grow.
